Grok's API is currently limited to information up to the **end of 2024**. Claude's Sonnet 4.5 has access to up-to-date information, but is considerably more expensive per output (nearly $1 per ticker). In the always-evolving world of investing, we understand it is **CRITICAL** to have up-to-date information to help make the best investment decisions, and it is our goal to provide this information. But considering there are thousands of companies that we would ideally be updating monthly, as well as future goals of also providing quick and digestible summaries and insights for newly released earnings and conference calls, breaking news, FED speeches, etc, this quickly becomes very costly.

For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. Thanks! - QuickTick AI

# CZWI Sell-Side Analysis Report
**Report Date:** October 10, 2024  
**Current Stock Price:** $13.25 (as of market close October 10, 2024, per Yahoo Finance and Nasdaq)  
**Market Capitalization:** $121.8 million (as of October 10, 2024, per Yahoo Finance)  
**52-Week Range:** $10.00 - $15.44  
**Dividend Yield:** 4.17% (annualized $0.56/share, ex-date September 13, 2024)  

## Company Overview (187 words)
Citizens Community Bancorp, Inc. (NASDAQ: CZWI) is a bank holding company headquartered in Eau Claire, Wisconsin, primarily operating through its subsidiary, Citizens Community Federal Bank. The company delivers a range of retail and commercial banking products and services to individuals, businesses, and agricultural customers across 23 full-service branches in Wisconsin (16 branches), Minnesota (5 branches), and Michigan (2 branches). Core offerings include deposit accounts (checking, savings, CDs, IRAs), consumer and mortgage loans, commercial real estate (CRE) loans, commercial and industrial (C&I) loans, agricultural loans, and consumer loans. As a community-focused lender, CZWI emphasizes relationship banking in rural and semi-rural Midwest markets, with a loan portfolio heavily weighted toward CRE (51% of total loans as of Q2 2024) and agriculture (18%). Total assets stood at $1.88 billion as of June 30, 2024, positioning it as a micro-cap regional bank. The bank maintains a conservative balance sheet with a Texas Ratio of 3.5% (Q2 2024), strong capital ratios (CET1 10.8%), and a focus on net interest margin expansion amid stabilizing rates. CZWI benefits from its niche in underserved agricultural communities but faces typical regional bank pressures from interest rate volatility and deposit competition.

## Recent Developments
- **Q2 2024 Earnings (Released July 25, 2024)**: Net income of $2.8 million ($0.30 diluted EPS, up 12% YoY); net interest income $16.7 million (up 3% QoQ); provision for credit losses $0.5 million; non-interest income $2.4 million (driven by mortgage and deposit fees). Deposits grew 2% QoQ to $1.52 billion; loans flat at $1.47 billion. NIM expanded 10 bps to 3.72%. (Source: Company 10-Q, Earnings Call Transcript via Seeking Alpha).
- **Q1 2024 Earnings (Released April 25, 2024)**: Net income $2.5 million ($0.27 EPS); NIM 3.62%. (Source: Company 10-Q).
- **Dividend Declaration (August 22, 2024)**: Quarterly dividend increased 3.7% to $0.14/share, payable October 21, 2024. (Source: GlobeNewswire press release).
- **Branch Optimization (Announced June 2024)**: Consolidated two Wisconsin branches into one to improve efficiency; no staff reductions. (Source: Earnings Call).
- **Online Discussions**: Limited buzz on StockTwits/Reddit (r/stocks, r/investing); sentiment neutral-positive on dividend hike and NIM stability amid regional bank rally post-election speculation (October 2024). No major controversies.

## Growth Strategy
- Organic expansion via core deposit growth (target 3-5% annual) and selective CRE/ag lending in core markets.
- Digital enhancements: Launched improved mobile app and online lending portal (Q1 2024) to attract younger customers.
- Fee income diversification: Emphasis on mortgage origination (up 15% YoY Q2 2024) and SBA lending.
- Capital management: Share repurchases authorized (none executed in 2024); focus on ROE >8% (achieved 6.1% TTM).

## Company and Sector Headwinds/Tailwinds
| Category | Tailwinds | Headwinds |
|----------|-----------|-----------|
| **Company-Specific** | Strong deposit beta decline (funding costs down 20 bps QoQ); low CRE criticized loans (0.8% past due); agile branch network in stable ag markets. | Loan growth stagnation (flat YoY); high CRE concentration (51%); sensitivity to farm economy downturns. |
| **Sector (Regional Banks)** | Fed rate cuts (September 18, 2024: 50 bps) boosting NIM; M&A thaw for small banks; Midwest ag recovery (corn/soy prices up 5% YTD). | Deposit outflows to money markets (industry-wide); CRE office exposure (minimal for CZWI); regulatory scrutiny on Basel III endgame. |

## Existing Products/Services
- **Deposits**: Non-interest-bearing (18% of total), interest-bearing checking/savings, time deposits.
- **Loans**: CRE (51%), C&I (15%), ag real estate (18%), residential mortgage (10%), consumer (6%).
- **Fee-Based**: Debit/credit cards, wealth management referrals, mortgage banking.

## New Products/Services/Projects
- **SBA Lending Expansion (Piloted Q3 2024)**: Targeting small business loans with government guarantees; early pipeline $10M.
- **Digital Mortgage Platform (Rolling out Q4 2024)**: Partnership with fintech for faster approvals.
- No major capex announced; focus on cost control (non-interest expense/asset 2.8% Q2 2024).

## Market Share Approximations
- Wisconsin community banking: ~0.2% of state deposits ($1.52B vs. $140B total; source: FDIC Q2 2024).
- Minnesota/Michigan: <0.1% each.
- Ag lending niche: 1-2% in western WI dairy/farm belt (qualitative, per earnings call mgmt. commentary).

## Forecast of Growth/Decline in Market Share
- **Short-Term (12 months)**: Stable to +0.5% via deposit gains from rate cuts; loan share flat amid competition.
- **Medium-Term (2-3 years)**: Modest +1-2% growth if ag economy strengthens (USDA forecasts 2025 farm income +3%); risk of decline if CRE defaults rise >1%.

## Comparison to Competitors
| Metric (Q2 2024) | CZWI | Nicolet Bankshares (NIC) | Park National (PRK) | Avg. Peer Group |
|------------------|-----|---------------------------|---------------------|-----------------|
| **Assets ($B)** | 1.88 | 9.2 | 11.6 | 5-10B peers |
| **NIM (%)** | 3.72 | 3.55 | 3.98 | 3.60 |
| **ROE (%) TTM** | 6.1 | 11.2 | 10.5 | 9.0 |
| **CET1 (%)** | 10.8 | 11.5 | 12.1 | 11.0 |
| **P/Tangible BV** | 1.05x | 1.45x | 1.60x | 1.30x |

*CZWI trades at discount to peers on valuation (P/E 11x vs. peer 13x) but lags growth/ROE due to smaller scale.

## Partnerships, M&A
- **Partnerships**: Fiserv for core processing/digital banking; Correspondent with larger banks for jumbo loans.
- **M&A**: No activity since 2019 acquisition of United Bank. CEO open to "strategic opportunities" (Q2 call, July 2024), but no targets named. Potential buyer profile: Larger Midwest regional like Old National (ONB).

## Current and Potential Major Clients
- **Current**: Agribusinesses (dairy co-ops in WI/MN), CRE developers (retail/industrial), small manufacturers. Top 10 borrowers <20% of portfolio.
- **Potential**: SBA-eligible manufacturers amid CHIPS Act funding; renewable energy farms in MI (wind/solar projects).

## Other Qualitative Measures
- **Management**: CEO Steve Andrews (since 2019) credited with NIM turnaround; avg. tenure 10+ years.
- **ESG**: Strong community reinvestment (51% loans-to-LMI areas); low carbon footprint as rural ops.
- **Risk Profile**: CRE stress-tested to -20% values (passes); no SVB-like securities issues.
- **Analyst Coverage**: Limited (1 analyst, DA Davidson "Neutral" $16 PT, September 2024).

## Investment Recommendation
- **Buy Rating: 6/10 (Hold with Upside Potential)**: Attractive 4%+ yield and NIM tailwinds from Fed cuts support holding; modest growth from ag/digital offsets CRE risks. Strong balance sheet suits moderate risk, but limited catalysts for "strong growth upside" cap at mid-single-digit returns. Peers trading higher suggest merger arb potential.
- **Estimated Fair Value: $15.50/share** (+17% upside): Based on 1.15x T/BV (peer avg. adjusted for size/ROE) on $13.45 T/BVPS (Q2 2024); DCF implies $14-17 range assuming 4% loan growth, 3.8% NIM, 7% ROE by 2026.
